title: How to write time 1:20 in Sanskrit - Quora

response.answer_text: In Sanskrit,while ending time we add vaadanam Here in 1:20 we can clearly see that it is 20 minutes more than one o’clock. In sanskrit 20 is vimshatihi,One is eka. As it is 20 minutes more than 1 it is vimsha+adhika+eka and as mentioned above +Vaadanam=vimshadhikaekavadanam So in English we tell 20 after one but in sanskrit we tell 20minutes more than one. Hope this helps:-)
Sanskrit Numbers From 1 to 20 One o'clock would be Ekavaadanam – एकवादनम्। 2 o'clock : Dvivaadanm – द्विवादनम्। 3 o'clock : Triivaadanm – त्रिवादनम्। 4 o'clock : Chaturvaadanm – चतुर्वादनम्।
